article.description: Jordan Hicks scored 21 points and Loyola of Chicago closed the first half on a 15-0 run Saturday en route to an 82-64 win over Western Michigan.
article.headline: Loyola of Chicago rides first-half run to victory
article.linkText: Loyola of Chicago rides first-half run to victory
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. -- Jordan Hicks scored 21 points and Loyola of Chicago closed the first half on a 15-0 run Saturday en route to an 82-64 win over Western Michigan. The Ramblers (5-0) led 23-22 with 5:46 remaining in the first half when Geoff McCammon and Hicks hit 3-pointers to spark the run. Western Michigan (0-2) had five turnovers and missed five shots during the stretch to fall behind 38-22 at halftime, and never got within 10 points of Loyola the rest of the way. Terrance Hill added 13 points and eight rebounds for the Ramblers, who shot 52.8 percent (28 for 53) from the field and were 8 for 17 from 3-point range. McCammon had 11 points. Flenard Whitfield had 17 points and eight rebounds for Western Michigan. Demetrius Ward added 14 points, and Nate Hutcheson had 12 points and eight rebounds. The Broncos made only 2 of 15 3-point shots in the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
